article:
[[Commonwealth of Australia]] (Entered the War on: 4 August 1914)

[[Austria-Hungary]] (Entered the War on: 28 July 1914)

Royalty *Archduke Franz Ferdinand, (1863â1914), heir to the throne whose murder
brought on the war. *Emperor Franz Josef I, (1830â1916) *Emperor Karl I,
(1887â1922), last emperor of Austria, last king of Hungary *Empress Zita,
(1892â1989), last empress of Austria, last queen of Hungary *Archduke Friedrich,
Duke of Teschen, Field Marshal and supreme commander of the Austro-Hungarian
(K.u.K.) Army *Archduke Charles Stephen of Austria, Grand Admiral in the Austro-
Hungarian (K.u.K.) Navy *Archduke Eugen of Austria, Field Marshal and commander
in the Balkins and later of the entire southwestern front *Archduke Joseph
August of Austria, the last Field Marshal of Austria-Hungary, commander of the
VII Corps, the 6th Army, and eventually the Army Group Tirol, also the last
Palatine of Hungary *Archduke Franz Salvator of Austria, General of Cavalry
(equivalent to lieutenant general), K.u.K., and Doctor of Medicine *Archduke
Josef Ferdinand of Austria, Feldmarschalleutnant (equivalent to major general),
and commander of XIV Corps, the 4th Army, and later inspector general of the
Imperial Air Force *Archduke Karl Albrecht of Austria, Colonel of Artillery of
both the Imperial (k.u.k.) Austro-Hungarian Army (on Horse) and the Polish Army
*Archduke Leo Karl of Austria, Captain, K.u.K., and served after the war as an
officer in the Polish Army *Archduke Wilhelm of Austria, Colonel of the
Ukrainian Sich Riflemen, and later served after the war as an officer in the
Polish Army

[[Canada]] (includes [[Dominion of Newfoundland|Newfoundland]]) (Entered the War
on: 4 August 1914)

Royalty Prince Arthur, Duke of Connaught and Strathearn (third son of Queen
Victoria), Governor General

Political Leaders
* Sir Robert Borden (1854â1937) Prime Minister (1911â1920)
* Henri Bourassa (1868â1952) led French Canadian opposition to conscription
* Sir Sam Hughes (1853â1921) Minister of Militia and Defense

Military
* Sir Arthur Currie (1875â1933) Division, later Corps commander (Canadian Corps)
* Sir Richard Turner (1871â1948) Chief of Canadian General Staff
* Billy Bishop (1884â1956), ace credited with 72 victories
* William Barker (1894â1930) was a fighter ace and Victoria Cross recipient
* Filip Konowal (1888â1959) Ukrainian-Canadian Victoria Cross recipient
* Tommy Ricketts (1901â1967) at age 17, he was the youngest soldier to ever
  receive the Victoria Cross
* Francis Pegahmagabow (1891â1952) the most highly decorated aboriginal Canadian
  soldier of World War I
* Henry Norwest (1884â1918) one of the most famous snipers in World War I
* Harry Band (1885â1915) reported victim of German crucifixion
* George Lawrence Price (1898â1918) last soldier killed in World War I (shot two
  minutes before the announcement of the Armistice)
* John McCrae (1872â1918) doctor and poet, author of "In Flanders Fields"

[[Democratic Republic of Armenia]]

Military leaders
* Tovmas Nazarbekian Commander-in-chief.

* Drastamat Kanayan
* Garegin Nzhdeh
* Movses Silikyan

Politicians
* Hovhannes Katchaznouni was the first Prime Minister of Armenia.
* Aram Manukian was the minister of Interior.

Others
* Avetis Aharonyan chairman the Armenian National Council which declared the DRA
